instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00430: What is 820-00430? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00034: What is 820-00034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message:
The board only turns on the first LED. The others don't light up, not even when I try to turn them on.

As there is no schematic for this board, I am a little confused.

I have 12.1v on <SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>FET_EN_P12V_S5</SIGNAL> was 15v, replaces the <CHIP>U6970</CHIP>, now I have 11.2v. The <CHIP>U6970</CHIP> I removed from another board.

any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>FET_EN_P12V_S5</SIGNAL> was 15v"
It should be 22V; Vgs=10V required.

If <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> is stable, try changing <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL> MOSFET.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message:
I'm a bit confused without the correct schematic.

I changed the Mosfet, but I don't know if it's S5 or S0. I'm using the 00034 scheme. The site shows 2 mosfets, the board has only one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message:
In the mentioned schematic, <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR> is <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL> MOSFET.
<TRANSISTOR>Q6970</TRANSISTOR> is <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> MOSFET.

Did you remove CMOS battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message:
Yes, I removed the battery.

In the schematic, I found the S0 and S5 mosfets. But on the board, no.
It is very different from the scheme. Where there are two mosfets in the schematic, the board has only one mosfet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 12v line problems
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview/schematic should help.
